snippet: Alan Turing, the British mathematician and cryptanalyst, has been denied a formal pardon by the government of Prime Minister David Cameron for his conviction in 1952 on charges of homosexuality.
abstract: Alan Turing, British mathematician and cryptanalyst, is denied a formal pardon by the government of Prime Min David Cameron for his conviction in 1952 on charges of homosexuality.
lead_paragraph: Alan Turing, the British mathematician and cryptanalyst, has been denied a formal pardon by the government of Prime Minister David Cameron for his conviction in 1952 on charges of homosexuality.

headline.seo: Britain: No Pardon for Alan Turing in 1952 Case
